intro: Senecio vicellipticus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf Senecio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces yellow flowers arranged in dense, terminal clusters. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by composite flower heads. Senecio vicellipticus is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
